questions.question_text: What happens when SaaS Security sees a new or unknown SaaS application?

choices.D: It extends the branch perimeter to the closest node with high performance.
choices.C: It generates alerts regarding changes in performance.
choices.B: It uses machine learning (ML) to classify the application.
choices.A: It forwards the application for WildFire analysis.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/saas-security/saas-security-admin/saas-security-inline/get-started-with-saas-security-inline/whats-saas-security-inline

Selected Answer: B
ML used, WF for files, PE etc.

Selected Answer: B
B !! OF COURSE

Selected Answer: B
B, (A is wrong as it's used for files, not applications)
Agree with B, see link from mushi4ka below

questions.question_text: Which type of access allows unmanaged endpoints to access secured on-premises applications?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
agree with raquinopsky, so D.

Clientless VPN enables secure remote access to enterprise applications from SSL-enabled web browsers. With Clientless VPN, end users are not required to install the GlobalProtect app software on their endpoints, which is useful when you need to enable partner or contractor access to applications and safely enable unmanaged assets, including personal endpoints
Correct answer is Global Protect
I think the answer should be "GlobalProtect"

Selected Answer: D
D globalprotect
Its global protect.

Selected Answer: D
It's not the CDL for sure. By elimination, D should be Global Protect but with ADEM addon.
Quizlet:C

Selected Answer: D
Global Protect helps helps ADEM, so D.

Selected Answer: D
Global Protect 100%

Selected Answer: D
Global protect

Selected Answer: D
GlobalProtect with the ADEM addon for Prisma Access is the correct answer. Absolutely NOT CDL lol
I think it should be D. GlobalProtect

questions.question_text: Which application gathers health telemetry about a device and its WiFi connectivity in order to help determine whether the device or the WiFi is the cause of any performance issues?

choices.B: Step 5: Monitor and maintain the network
choices.A: Step 3: Architect a Zero Trust network
choices.C: Step 4: Create the Zero Trust policy

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/what-is-zero-trust/ba-p/292327

Selected Answer: C
Kipling = step 4, so C.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/the-five-step-methodology/step-4-implementation

It is C, see also:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Five_Ws

questions.question_text: In which step of the Five-Step Methodology for implementing the Zero Trust model is the Kipling Method relevant?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree with D: D. Exclusive use of web proxies leads to significant blind spots in traffic and an inability to identify applications and threats on non-standard ports or across multiple protocols.

choices.C: Proxy solutions require an unprecedented level of interconnectivity.
choices.D: Exclusive use of web proxies leads to significant blind spots in traffic and an inability to identify applications and threats on non-standard ports or across multiple protocols.
choices.B: Teams added additional tools to web proxies that promised to solve point problems, resulting in a fragmented and ineffective security architecture.
choices.A: Proxies force policy actions to be treated as business decisions instead of compromises due to technical limitations.

questions.question_text: What is a disadvantage of proxy secure access service edge (SASE) when compared to an inline SASE solution?
